title: Reuberg
text:
The Reuberg is a ridge, up to , in the <a href="Lower%20Saxon%20Hills">Lower Saxon Hills</a> in the districts of <a href="Landkreis%20Holzminden">Holzminden</a> and <a href="Landkreis%20Hildesheim">Hildesheim</a> in the German state of <a href="Lower%20Saxony">Lower Saxony</a>.
Location.
The Reuberg lies in the western part of the <a href="Leine%20Uplands">Leine Uplands</a>, a northern section of the <a href="Lower%20Saxon%20Hills">Lower Saxon Hills</a>. It measures about 3.5 kilometres in length and is situated within the triangle formed by the settlements of <a href="Alfeld%20%28Leine%29">Alfeld</a>, <a href="Delligsen">Delligsen</a> and <a href="Duingen">Duingen</a>. It also lies between <a href="Brunkensen">Brunkensen</a> to the north, <a href="Warzen%20%28Alfeld%29">Warzen</a> to the east, <a href="Gerzen%20%28Alfeld%29">Gerzen</a> to the southeast, <a href="Gr%C3%BCnenplan">Grünenplan</a> some distance away to the east-southeast, <a href="Hohenb%C3%BCchen%20%28Delligsen%29">Hohenbüchen</a> to the west and some way from <a href="Coppengrave">Coppengrave</a> to the northwest. 
The hill ranges around the Reuberg are the <a href="Duinger%20Berg">Duinger Berg</a> to the northwest, <a href="K%C3%BClf">Külf</a> to the north, the <a href="Sieben%20Berge%20%28ridge%29">Sieben Berge</a> to the east, the <a href="Steinberg%20%28Leine%20Uplands%29">Steinberg</a> to the southeast, the ridge of <a href="Hils">Hils</a> to the southwest and further to the west the knife-edge of the <a href="Ith">Ith</a>, part of which belongs to the <a href="Weser%20Uplands-Schaumburg-Hamelin%20Nature%20Park">Weser Uplands-Schaumburg-Hamelin Nature Park</a>. The valley of the Glene, a southwestern tributary of the River <a href="Leine%20%28Aller%29">Leine</a>, runs over to the Duinger Berg. 
On the eponymous main summit of the Reuberg (), stands a <a href="transmission%20mast">transmission mast</a> belonging to <a href="Deutsche%20Telekom">Deutsche Telekom</a>. On the northwestern slopes of the ridge are the <a href="Lippold%20Cave">Lippold Cave</a> and the <a href="cultural%20monument">cultural monument</a> of Gleneburg. The <a href="Bundesstra%C3%9Fe%203">B 3</a> federal road runs past the Reuberg some way to the east.
Hiking.
Several forest tracks and footpaths pass over the Reuberg, including one that runs over the crest from the valley of the Glene to Warzen. The <a href="E11%20European%20long%20distance%20path">E11 European long distance path</a> runs past the hill between Grünenplan and Gerzen where the Reuberg transitions to the <a href="Steinberg%20%28Leine%20Uplands%29">Steinberg</a>.
